To the chief Musician, A Psalm for the sons of Korah. Hear this, all <FI>ye<Fi> people; give ear, all <FI>ye<Fi> inhabitants of the world:<RF>for: or, of<Rf>
Both low and high, rich and poor, together.
My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart <FI>shall be<Fi> of understanding.
I will incline mine ear to a parable: I will open my dark saying upon the harp.
Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil, <FI>when<Fi> the iniquity of my heels shall compass me about?<CM>
They that trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;
None <FI>of them<Fi> can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him:
(For the redemption of their soul <FI>is<Fi> precious, and it ceaseth for ever:)
That he should still live for ever, <FI>and<Fi> not see corruption.
For he seeth <FI>that<Fi> wise men die, likewise the fool and the brutish person perish, and leave their wealth to others.

Their inward thought <FI>is, that<Fi> their houses <FI>shall continue<Fi> for ever, <FI>and<Fi> their dwelling places to all generations; they call <FI>their<Fi> lands after their own names.<RF>all…: Heb. generation and generation<Rf>
Nevertheless man <FI>being<Fi> in honour abideth not: he is like the beasts <FI>that<Fi> perish.
This their way <FI>is<Fi> their folly: yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.<RF>approve…: Heb. delight in their mouth<Rf>

Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their beauty shall consume in the grave from their dwelling.<RF>beauty: or, strength<Rf><RF>in the grave from…: or, the grave being an habitation to every one of them<Rf><CM>
But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he shall receive me. Selah.<RF>power: Heb. hand<Rf><RF>the grave: or, hell<Rf>
Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased;
For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away: his glory shall not descend after him.
Though while he lived he blessed his soul: and <FI>men<Fi> will praise thee, when thou doest well to thyself.<RF>while…: Heb. in his life<Rf>
He shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never see light.<RF>He…: Heb. The soul shall<Rf>
Man <FI>that is<Fi> in honour, and understandeth not, is like the beasts <FI>that<Fi> perish.<CM>
